title: Water Harvesting for Aquaculture in Timor-Leste Quiz

questions.question: What is the main purpose of water harvesting in the context of aquaculture?
choices: To collect and store water for fish ponds
To irrigate crops
To provide drinking water for livestock
To generate hydroelectric power
questions.answer: To collect and store water for fish ponds

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a water harvesting technique mentioned in the lesson?
choices: Desalination
Swales
Ponds
Tanks and cisterns
questions.answer: Desalination

questions.question: What is a swale?
choices: A shallow trench that follows the contour of the land
A deep well for extracting groundwater
A large tank for storing rainwater
A type of fish commonly raised in aquaculture
questions.answer: A shallow trench that follows the contour of the land

questions.question: What is the purpose of building swales?
choices: To slow down and capture runoff water
To direct water away from the land
To provide habitat for aquatic plants
To serve as breeding grounds for fish
questions.answer: To slow down and capture runoff water

questions.question: What is the main benefit of storing water in ponds?
choices: It provides a reliable water source for fish ponds
It increases the speed of water flow
It helps to drain excess water from the land
It eliminates the need for water filtration
questions.answer: It provides a reliable water source for fish ponds

questions.question: What is the purpose of installing rainwater tanks or cisterns?
choices: To collect and store rainwater for later use
To purify contaminated groundwater
To breed fish in a controlled environment
To measure the amount of rainfall in an area
questions.answer: To collect and store rainwater for later use

questions.question: What is the first step in building a fish pond?
choices: Choosing a suitable location
Filling the pond with water
Stocking the pond with fish
Installing a filtration system
questions.answer: Choosing a suitable location

questions.question: What should be considered when choosing a location for a fish pond?
choices: Proximity to a water source
Exposure to direct sunlight
Accessibility for harvesting fish
All of the above
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the recommended shape for a fish pond?
choices: Rectangular or square
Circular
Triangular
Irregular
questions.answer: Rectangular or square

questions.question: What is the purpose of lining a fish pond with clay or a synthetic liner?
choices: To prevent water from seeping out
To make the pond look more attractive
To provide a surface for algae growth
To keep predators out of the pond
questions.answer: To prevent water from seeping out

questions.question: What is the recommended depth for a fish pond?
choices: At least 1.5 meters deep
Less than 0.5 meters deep
Between 0.5 and 1 meter deep
The depth doesn't matter
questions.answer: At least 1.5 meters deep

questions.question: Why is it important to maintain good water quality in a fish pond?
choices: To ensure the health and growth of the fish
To make the water look clearer
To attract wild birds to the pond
To increase evaporation rates
questions.answer: To ensure the health and growth of the fish

questions.question: What is the purpose of installing a water inlet and outlet in a fish pond?
choices: To allow for water exchange and circulation
To make it easier to catch the fish
To prevent algae growth
To keep the water cold
questions.answer: To allow for water exchange and circulation

questions.question: What does the term 'contour' mean in the context of building swales?
choices: The shape of the land surface
The depth of the swale
The type of soil in the area
The height of the berm
questions.answer: The shape of the land surface

questions.question: What is the purpose of allowing water to slowly infiltrate into the ground from a swale?
choices: To recharge groundwater
To increase surface runoff
To cause erosion
To drain the soil
questions.answer: To recharge groundwater

questions.question: What is a reservoir?
choices: A large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply
A type of fish feed
A device for measuring water flow
A chemical used to treat pond water
questions.answer: A large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply

questions.question: What is a cistern?
choices: A waterproof container for storing water
A type of aquatic plant
A unit of measurement for pond size
A tool for digging swales
questions.answer: A waterproof container for storing water

questions.question: What is erosion?
choices: The gradual destruction or washing away of soil by water or wind
The accumulation of sediment in a pond
The growth of beneficial bacteria in pond water
The process of harvesting fish from a pond
questions.answer: The gradual destruction or washing away of soil by water or wind

questions.question: What is an ecosystem?
choices: A community of living organisms interacting with their environment
A type of fish feed
A method of water filtration
A material used for pond lining
questions.answer: A community of living organisms interacting with their environment

questions.question: How can swales help to reduce erosion?
choices: By slowing down water flow and allowing it to infiltrate the soil
By directing water away from the land
By increasing the speed of water runoff
By removing vegetation from the land surface
questions.answer: By slowing down water flow and allowing it to infiltrate the soil

questions.question: What is the benefit of integrating water harvesting techniques with a fish pond?
choices: It ensures a consistent supply of water for the pond
It eliminates the need for water filtration
It automatically harvests the fish
It prevents algae growth in the pond
questions.answer: It ensures a consistent supply of water for the pond

questions.question: What is the purpose of adding compost or manure to a fish pond?
choices: To provide nutrients for the growth of natural fish food
To make the water clearer
To increase the pH level of the water
To attract predators to the pond
questions.answer: To provide nutrients for the growth of natural fish food

questions.question: What is the recommended frequency for partially draining and refilling a fish pond?
choices: Every 1-2 weeks
Once a month
Once a year
Never
questions.answer: Every 1-2 weeks

questions.question: Why is it important to prevent excessive algae growth in a fish pond?
choices: Algae can deplete oxygen levels in the water
Algae make the water look clearer
Algae provide a natural food source for the fish
Algae help to regulate the water temperature
questions.answer: Algae can deplete oxygen levels in the water

questions.question: What is the purpose of stocking a fish pond with a variety of species?
choices: To create a balanced ecosystem
To make the pond look more colorful
To increase competition among the fish
To make it easier to harvest the fish
questions.answer: To create a balanced ecosystem

questions.question: What is the benefit of raising fish that feed at different levels of the pond?
choices: It maximizes the use of available food resources
It makes the fish easier to catch
It prevents the fish from reproducing
It eliminates the need for water filtration
questions.answer: It maximizes the use of available food resources

questions.question: What is the purpose of monitoring the pH level of pond water?
choices: To ensure the water is suitable for the fish
To make the water taste better
To prevent algae growth
To attract wild birds to the pond
questions.answer: To ensure the water is suitable for the fish

questions.question: What is the ideal pH range for most fish ponds?
choices: Between 6.5 and 9.0
Between 4.0 and 5.0
Between 10.0 and 11.0
The pH level doesn't matter
questions.answer: Between 6.5 and 9.0

questions.question: What is the purpose of providing supplementary feed to fish in a pond?
choices: To ensure they have enough food to grow quickly
To make the water clearer
To prevent algae growth
To attract predators to the pond
questions.answer: To ensure they have enough food to grow quickly

questions.question: What is the recommended time of day for feeding fish in a pond?
choices: Early morning and late afternoon
Mid-day when the sun is strongest
Late at night
The time of day doesn't matter
questions.answer: Early morning and late afternoon

questions.question: What is the purpose of harvesting fish selectively and gradually from a pond?
choices: To maintain a balanced population and allow for continuous harvests
To remove all the fish at once
To make room for new species of fish
To drain the pond completely
questions.answer: To maintain a balanced population and allow for continuous harvests
